intro: Zannichellia prodanii, commonly known as the water starwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Pontederiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, floating leaves that are typically oval or elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in spikes, often emerging from the water surface. It thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and lakes. Zannichellia prodanii is often found in nutrient-rich waters and can be an indicator of eutrophic conditions.
